column4: i just put a blank dvd in my drive and am trying to use the built in ubuntu burn:/// window to burn one, however when I click write to disc it just says please insert a blank dvd. the drive works, I just burnt a dvd in windows yesterday, and I've tried 3 different DVDs (including different brands).
It popped up "you have just inserted a blank dvd, what would you like to do?" so it does recognize that it's a blank dvd at least somewhere
have you tried using gnomebaker or k3b to burn with?
nope, just realized it was selecting my other dvd drive to try and burn with haha. thanks :D
